script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Both books are about rain, but each tells you something different about it!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Book 1: "The sun is very hot and gives us light." üìñ Book 2: "The sun helps plants grow by giving them energy."<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What do BOTH books agree on?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> The sun is cold.? <break time='400ms'/> Plants don't need the sun.? <break time='400ms'/> The sun is important and gives things to Earth.? <break time='400ms'/> or The sun is a planet.? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Both books talk about what the sun gives ‚Äî light, energy, growth!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Book 1: "Dogs need water, food, and walks every day." üìñ Book 2: "Dogs can be trained to sit, stay, and shake."<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Book 1 is about CARING for dogs. Book 2 is about...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Cats? <break time='400ms'/> Wild dogs? <break time='400ms'/> Caring for dogs? <break time='400ms'/> or Training dogs? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Sit, stay, and shake are all tricks ‚Äî that's training!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Book 1: "Butterflies have colorful wings and drink nectar from flowers." üìñ Book 2: "Butterflies start as caterpillars and go through metamorphosis."<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is SIMILAR about both books?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> They both talk about caterpillars.? <break time='400ms'/> They are about different insects.? <break time='400ms'/> They both talk about wings.? <break time='400ms'/> or They are both about butterflies.? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Even though they share different facts, they're both about the same creature!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>When we read a book in English, we start on which side?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> The right side? <break time='400ms'/> The bottom? <break time='400ms'/> The left side? <break time='400ms'/> or The middle? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! We read from LEFT to right!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>When you finish reading a line of words, where do you look next?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Down to the next line on the left side? <break time='400ms'/> Anywhere you want? <break time='400ms'/> To the right of the line? <break time='400ms'/> or Back to the same line? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Your eyes sweep down and back to the left to start the next line!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>When you finish a page, what do you do?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Start over from the beginning? <break time='400ms'/> Skip to the last page? <break time='400ms'/> Close the book? <break time='400ms'/> or Turn to the next page? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! We read page by page ‚Äî one after another!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which arrow shows the direction we READ words?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Top to bottom only? <break time='400ms'/> ‚û°Ô∏è Left to right? <break time='400ms'/> ‚¨ÖÔ∏è Right to left? <break time='400ms'/> or ‚¨áÔ∏è Bottom to top? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! In English, our eyes go from the LEFT side to the RIGHT side!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Where do you START reading on a page?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Bottom right corner? <break time='400ms'/> Bottom left corner? <break time='400ms'/> Top left corner? <break time='400ms'/> or Top right corner? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! We start at the TOP and on the LEFT ‚Äî then go right and down!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Put the words in order to make a sentence.</emphasis><break time='400ms'/></speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Start with a capital letter and end with a period.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Put the words in the right order.</emphasis><break time='400ms'/></speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Start with 'I' and end with a period.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Arrange the words to build a sentence.</emphasis><break time='400ms'/></speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Start with a capital letter. What did the dog do?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>When you SAY the word "cat," how do we WRITE it?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> K-a-t? <break time='400ms'/> C-a-t? <break time='400ms'/> K-t-a? <break time='400ms'/> or C-t-a? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The word 'cat' uses the letters C, A, and T in that order!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Words are made up of...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Letters? <break time='400ms'/> Colors? <break time='400ms'/> Shapes? <break time='400ms'/> or Numbers? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! A, B, C, D... we use these to build words!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>You say the word "dog." Which letters spell that word?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> D-o-t? <break time='400ms'/> D-o-g? <break time='400ms'/> G-o-d? <break time='400ms'/> or B-o-g? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Sound it out: /d/ - /o/ - /g/. What letters make those sounds?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>If you change the letters in a word, what happens?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Nothing changes? <break time='400ms'/> The letters disappear? <break time='400ms'/> You get a different word or a nonsense word? <break time='400ms'/> or The word stays the same? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! C-A-T is 'cat' but C-A-P is 'cap' ‚Äî different letters make different words!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Every word we say can also be...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Only spoken, never written? <break time='400ms'/> Made with numbers? <break time='400ms'/> Written with letters? <break time='400ms'/> or Drawn as a picture only? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! We can write down anything we say using letters!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which sentence uses spaces CORRECTLY?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Ilikedogs? <break time='400ms'/> Ilike dogs? <break time='400ms'/> I l i k e d o g s? <break time='400ms'/> or I like dogs? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Each WORD gets its own space between it and the next word!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Why do we put SPACES between words?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> To make writing slower? <break time='400ms'/> So we can tell where one word ends and the next begins? <break time='400ms'/> Because spaces are letters too? <break time='400ms'/> or To waste paper? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Without spaces, all the words would smush together!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Look: "thecat sat" ‚Äî How many words is this SUPPOSED to be?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> 1 word? <break time='400ms'/> 3 words? <break time='400ms'/> 4 words? <break time='400ms'/> or 2 words? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! It should be: the cat sat ‚Äî that's 3 separate words!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>How many WORDS are in this sentence? "I am happy."</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> 1? <break time='400ms'/> 2? <break time='400ms'/> 3? <break time='400ms'/> or 7? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Count the groups of letters separated by spaces: I / am / happy.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>You're writing "My dog is big." Where do the spaces go?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Mydogisbig (no spaces)? <break time='400ms'/> M y d o g i s b i g (between each letter)? <break time='400ms'/> My dog is big (between each word)? <break time='400ms'/> or My dogis big (only one space)? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Put a space between each word ‚Äî not between each letter!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which is the UPPERCASE (capital) version of the letter a?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> A? <break time='400ms'/> B? <break time='400ms'/> A? <break time='400ms'/> or D? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Uppercase letters are BIG letters ‚Äî the capital version of 'a' is...</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which is the LOWERCASE (small) version of the letter G?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> G? <break time='400ms'/> J? <break time='400ms'/> G? <break time='400ms'/> or Q? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Lowercase letters are small letters. The small 'G' looks like 'g.'</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which pair shows the SAME letter in uppercase and lowercase?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> M and m? <break time='400ms'/> B and d? <break time='400ms'/> P and q? <break time='400ms'/> or R and s? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! One should be the big version and the other the small version of the same letter!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What letter comes AFTER M in the alphabet?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> L? <break time='400ms'/> N? <break time='400ms'/> K? <break time='400ms'/> or O? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Sing the alphabet song: ...K, L, M, __, O...</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>How many letters are in the English alphabet?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> 30? <break time='400ms'/> 20? <break time='400ms'/> 26? <break time='400ms'/> or 24? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! From A to Z, there are 26 letters!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word RHYMES with "cat"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Cup? <break time='400ms'/> Dog? <break time='400ms'/> Hat? <break time='400ms'/> or Sun? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Rhyming words sound the same at the END. Cat... hat... they both end in -at!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word RHYMES with "sun"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Moon? <break time='400ms'/> Fun? <break time='400ms'/> Bed? <break time='400ms'/> or Sat? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Sun and ___ both end with the -un sound!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word does NOT rhyme with "ball"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Wall? <break time='400ms'/> Tall? <break time='400ms'/> Dog? <break time='400ms'/> or Fall? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Ball, tall, wall, fall all end in -all. Which one doesn't?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which pair of words RHYMES?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Top ‚Äî sun? <break time='400ms'/> Big ‚Äî pig? <break time='400ms'/> Red ‚Äî blue? <break time='400ms'/> or Cat ‚Äî dog? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Rhyming words end with the same sound. Which pair sounds alike at the end?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Pick a word that rhymes with "hop."</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Hot? <break time='400ms'/> Hug? <break time='400ms'/> Hit? <break time='400ms'/> or Stop? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Hop ends with -op. Which other word ends with -op?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>How many SYLLABLES (claps) are in the word "cat"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> 2? <break time='400ms'/> 1? <break time='400ms'/> 4? <break time='400ms'/> or 3? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Say it and clap: CAT. Just one clap!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>How many SYLLABLES (claps) are in the word "banana"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> 1? <break time='400ms'/> 2? <break time='400ms'/> 3? <break time='400ms'/> or 4? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Clap it out: ba-NA-na. That's 3 claps!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>How many SYLLABLES are in the word "butterfly"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> 4? <break time='400ms'/> 3? <break time='400ms'/> 1? <break time='400ms'/> or 2? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Clap it: BUT-ter-fly. Count the claps!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word has 2 syllables?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Apple? <break time='400ms'/> Dog? <break time='400ms'/> Cat? <break time='400ms'/> or Fish? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Clap each word: dog (1), ap-ple (2), cat (1), fish (1).</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Put these syllables together: "rain" + "bow." What word is it?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Raindrop? <break time='400ms'/> Rainfall? <break time='400ms'/> Raincoat? <break time='400ms'/> or Rainbow? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Blend the parts together: rain + bow = ?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Blend these sounds together: c + at. What word is it?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Cat? <break time='400ms'/> Mat? <break time='400ms'/> Bat? <break time='400ms'/> or Sat? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Put the /c/ sound in front of -at!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Blend: s + un. What word is it?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Run? <break time='400ms'/> Sun? <break time='400ms'/> Bun? <break time='400ms'/> or Fun? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Start with the /s/ sound, then add -un!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Break the word "mop" into two parts: the first sound and the rest.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which is correct?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> m + op? <break time='400ms'/> mo + p? <break time='400ms'/> m + o + p? <break time='400ms'/> or mp + o? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The onset (first sound) is /m/. The rime (rest of the word) is -op.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Blend: b + ig. What word do you get?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Bug? <break time='400ms'/> Big? <break time='400ms'/> Bog? <break time='400ms'/> or Bag? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! /b/ in front of -ig = ?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the FIRST sound (onset) in the word "top"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> to? <break time='400ms'/> o? <break time='400ms'/> t? <break time='400ms'/> or p? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The onset is the very first sound before the vowel!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the FIRST sound in the word "map"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> m? <break time='400ms'/> a? <break time='400ms'/> s? <break time='400ms'/> or p? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Say 'map' slowly ‚Äî what sound does your mouth make first?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the LAST sound in the word "bus"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> s? <break time='400ms'/> z? <break time='400ms'/> b? <break time='400ms'/> or u? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Say 'bus' ‚Äî what sound do you hear at the very end?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the MIDDLE sound in the word "pig"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> g? <break time='400ms'/> a? <break time='400ms'/> i? <break time='400ms'/> or p? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! P - I - G. The middle sound is the vowel!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the FIRST sound in the word "fun"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> u? <break time='400ms'/> s? <break time='400ms'/> f? <break time='400ms'/> or n? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Say 'fun' slowly. The very first sound is...</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> The word "bed" has 3 sounds: b - e - d.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the MIDDLE sound?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> e? <break time='400ms'/> b? <break time='400ms'/> a? <break time='400ms'/> or d? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The middle sound is always the vowel ‚Äî the one in between!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Start with "cat." Change the c to b. What new word do you get?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Sat? <break time='400ms'/> Bat? <break time='400ms'/> Mat? <break time='400ms'/> or Hat? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Take away the 'c' sound and put in a 'b' sound: b-at!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Start with "hop." Change the h to t. What word do you get?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Top? <break time='400ms'/> Pop? <break time='400ms'/> Cop? <break time='400ms'/> or Mop? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Replace the /h/ with /t/: t-op!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Start with "man." Change the a to e. What word do you get?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Mun? <break time='400ms'/> Mon? <break time='400ms'/> Min? <break time='400ms'/> or Men? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Keep the 'm' and 'n' but change the middle sound to /e/!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Start with "sit." Change the t to p. What word do you get?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Sip? <break time='400ms'/> Set? <break time='400ms'/> Sat? <break time='400ms'/> or Sap? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Keep 'si-' and change the ending to /p/!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Add s to the beginning of "top." What word do you get?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Spot? <break time='400ms'/> Stop? <break time='400ms'/> Step? <break time='400ms'/> or Tops? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Put /s/ right before 'top': s-top!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What sound does the letter B make?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> b? <break time='400ms'/> d? <break time='400ms'/> g? <break time='400ms'/> or p? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think of words that start with B: ball, bat, bear. They all start with /b/!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What sound does the letter S make?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> t? <break time='400ms'/> z? <break time='400ms'/> f? <break time='400ms'/> or s? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think: snake, sun, sit ‚Äî they all start with the /s/ sound!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which letter makes the m sound?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> W? <break time='400ms'/> M? <break time='400ms'/> B? <break time='400ms'/> or N? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Mmm... like 'mom' and 'milk'!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word STARTS with the same sound as the letter T?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Dog? <break time='400ms'/> Run? <break time='400ms'/> Top? <break time='400ms'/> or Fish? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The letter T makes the /t/ sound. Which word starts with /t/?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What sound does the letter R make?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> n? <break time='400ms'/> l? <break time='400ms'/> w? <break time='400ms'/> or r? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think of 'run,' 'red,' and 'rain' ‚Äî they all start with /r/!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> The word "cake" has a LONG a sound. The word "cat" has a SHORT a sound.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word has a LONG a sound?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Ran? <break time='400ms'/> Lake? <break time='400ms'/> Bat? <break time='400ms'/> or Hat? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Long 'a' says its own name ‚Äî like in 'lake' and 'cake'!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word has a SHORT i sound (like in "pig")?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Sit? <break time='400ms'/> Nine? <break time='400ms'/> Kite? <break time='400ms'/> or Bike? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Short 'i' sounds like the 'i' in pig, sit, and big!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>The word "note" has a LONG o sound. Which other word has a LONG o sound?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Mop? <break time='400ms'/> Dog? <break time='400ms'/> Bone? <break time='400ms'/> or Hot? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Long 'o' says its name ‚Äî like 'bone' and 'note'!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word has a SHORT e sound (like in "bed")?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Me? <break time='400ms'/> Tree? <break time='400ms'/> Bee? <break time='400ms'/> or Red? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Short 'e' sounds like the 'e' in bed, red, and pet!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word has a SHORT u sound (like in "bus")?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Cup? <break time='400ms'/> Cute? <break time='400ms'/> Tune? <break time='400ms'/> or Mule? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Short 'u' sounds like the 'u' in bus, cup, and sun!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word is "the"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Hte? <break time='400ms'/> Teh? <break time='400ms'/> The? <break time='400ms'/> or Eth? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Look carefully at the order of the letters: t-h-e!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Fill in the blank: "I can ___ it!"</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Od? <break time='400ms'/> Do? <break time='400ms'/> Doe? <break time='400ms'/> or Doo? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! This common word is spelled: d-o!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which sentence uses the word "is" correctly?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> He iz happy? <break time='400ms'/> He si happy? <break time='400ms'/> He is happy? <break time='400ms'/> or He es happy? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The word 'is' is spelled: i-s!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Read this sight word: "you".<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which sentence uses it?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> I see yew!? <break time='400ms'/> I see yu!? <break time='400ms'/> I see you!? <break time='400ms'/> or I see yoo!? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The word 'you' is spelled: y-o-u!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> She ___ my friend.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which sight word fits?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> It? <break time='400ms'/> Are? <break time='400ms'/> Am? <break time='400ms'/> or Is? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! We say 'She is' ‚Äî not 'She am' or 'She are.'</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Look at these words: CAT and BAT.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which letter is DIFFERENT?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> The first letter? <break time='400ms'/> The middle letter? <break time='400ms'/> No letters are different? <break time='400ms'/> or The last letter? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! C-A-T and B-A-T ‚Äî which letter changed?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>PAN and PEN are different because...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> They are the same word? <break time='400ms'/> The last letter is different? <break time='400ms'/> The middle letter is different? <break time='400ms'/> or The first letter is different? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! P-A-N vs P-E-N ‚Äî the 'A' changed to 'E'!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>BIG and BIG ‚Äî Are these the same or different?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Same? <break time='400ms'/> or Different? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Look at every letter: B-I-G and B-I-G. Any differences?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>MAP and MOP ‚Äî what letter changed?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Nothing changed? <break time='400ms'/> M? <break time='400ms'/> P? <break time='400ms'/> or A changed to O? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! M-A-P vs M-O-P ‚Äî the middle vowel is different!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>If you change the D in "dog" to L, what new word do you get?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Log? <break time='400ms'/> Fog? <break time='400ms'/> Hog? <break time='400ms'/> or Bog? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! D-O-G ‚Üí L-O-G!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> I see a cat. The cat is big. The cat is on the mat.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Where is the cat?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Under the table? <break time='400ms'/> In a tree? <break time='400ms'/> On the mat? <break time='400ms'/> or On the bed? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Read the last sentence ‚Äî where is the cat sitting?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> I like dogs. I like cats. I like fish. I like all pets!<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is this story about?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Pets? <break time='400ms'/> Food? <break time='400ms'/> School? <break time='400ms'/> or Toys? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Dogs, cats, and fish are all types of...</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> I can run. I can hop. I can skip. I can do a lot!<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What CAN'T this person do according to the story?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Fly? <break time='400ms'/> Skip? <break time='400ms'/> Run? <break time='400ms'/> or Hop? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The story mentions run, hop, and skip ‚Äî but NOT fly!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> The sun is up. It is day. We can play!<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What time of day is it?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Bedtime? <break time='400ms'/> Nighttime? <break time='400ms'/> Dinnertime? <break time='400ms'/> or Daytime? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The sun is up and the story says 'It is day.'</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Mom said, "Get your coat." Dad said, "Get your hat." It is cold outside!<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>WHY did Mom and Dad tell the child to get a coat and hat?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> It's bedtime? <break time='400ms'/> It's cold outside? <break time='400ms'/> It's hot outside? <break time='400ms'/> or It's time for school.? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The last sentence tells you why!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>A NOUN is a person, place, or thing. Which word is a noun?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Quickly? <break time='400ms'/> Dog? <break time='400ms'/> Happy? <break time='400ms'/> or Run? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Can you touch it or point to it? That's a noun!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>A VERB is an action word. Which word is a verb?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Jump? <break time='400ms'/> Cat? <break time='400ms'/> Big? <break time='400ms'/> or Red? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Which word is something you can DO?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the PLURAL (more than one) of "cat"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Catties? <break time='400ms'/> Cat? <break time='400ms'/> Cats? <break time='400ms'/> or Cates? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! To make most words plural, just add an 's' at the end!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word do you use to ask about a PLACE?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> When? <break time='400ms'/> Who? <break time='400ms'/> What? <break time='400ms'/> or Where? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! "_____ is the park?" ‚Äî you're asking about a place!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>"The ball is ___ the box." Which word means inside the box?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Behind? <break time='400ms'/> Under? <break time='400ms'/> On? <break time='400ms'/> or In? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! If the ball is INSIDE the box, we say it's 'in' the box!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which sentence has CORRECT capitalization?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> I like pizza? <break time='400ms'/> I LIKE PIZZA? <break time='400ms'/> I Like Pizza? <break time='400ms'/> or I like pizza? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The first word of a sentence starts with a CAPITAL letter!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What goes at the END of a telling sentence like "I see a dog"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> A question mark (?)? <break time='400ms'/> Nothing? <break time='400ms'/> An exclamation mark (!)? <break time='400ms'/> or A period (.)? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! A telling sentence (statement) ends with a period!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>What goes at the END of a question?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> A period (.)? <break time='400ms'/> A comma (,)? <break time='400ms'/> Nothing? <break time='400ms'/> or A question mark (?)? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Questions ask something ‚Äî they end with this curvy mark!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which name is written CORRECTLY?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> SAm? <break time='400ms'/> SaM? <break time='400ms'/> Sam? <break time='400ms'/> or Sam? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! People's names ALWAYS start with a capital letter!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which sentence is CORRECT?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> The Dog is big.? <break time='400ms'/> The dog is big? <break time='400ms'/> The dog is big? <break time='400ms'/> or The dog is big.? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! A correct sentence needs: capital letter at the start AND a period at the end!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> The boy JUMPED. He went up in the air.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>The -ed at the end of "jumped" tells us...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> It will happen later.? <break time='400ms'/> It already happened? <break time='400ms'/> It's happening right now.? <break time='400ms'/> or It never happened? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The ending '-ed' means something already happened ‚Äî in the past!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> The UNHAPPY girl frowned.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What does UN- at the beginning of unhappy mean?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Very? <break time='400ms'/> Not? <break time='400ms'/> Always? <break time='400ms'/> or More? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Un- means 'not.' So unhappy means NOT happy!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>"She has two dogs." The -s on "dogs" means...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> A big dog? <break time='400ms'/> A small dog? <break time='400ms'/> One dog? <break time='400ms'/> or More than one dog? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Adding '-s' usually means there is more than one!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> He was HELPFUL at school.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>The -ful in helpful means...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Never helping? <break time='400ms'/> A little help? <break time='400ms'/> Full of help? <break time='400ms'/> or Without help? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! -ful means 'full of.' So helpful means full of help!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> The CARELESS boy spilled his milk.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>The -less in careless means...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Full of care? <break time='400ms'/> Lots of care? <break time='400ms'/> Without care? <break time='400ms'/> or More care? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! -less means 'without.' Careless = without care (not being careful)!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Apple, banana, and orange all belong to which CATEGORY?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Vegetables? <break time='400ms'/> Fruits? <break time='400ms'/> Animals? <break time='400ms'/> or Colors? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! These are all things you eat that grow on trees or bushes ‚Äî they're all types of...</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>‚ÜîÔ∏è What is the OPPOSITE of "hot"?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Warm? <break time='400ms'/> Cold? <break time='400ms'/> Wet? <break time='400ms'/> or Big? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Opposites are as different as can be. If something isn't hot, it's...</speak>

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word means to walk in a PROUD, fancy way?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Strut? <break time='400ms'/> Crawl? <break time='400ms'/> Tiptoe? <break time='400ms'/> or Stumble? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think of a peacock walking proudly ‚Äî that's strutting!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Dog, cat, and fish all belong to which CATEGORY?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Animals? <break time='400ms'/> Colors? <break time='400ms'/> Toys? <break time='400ms'/> or Foods? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! They are all living creatures ‚Äî what group do they belong to?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Put these in order from LEAST happy to MOST happy:.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>smile, laugh, giggle</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Laugh, giggle, smile? <break time='400ms'/> Laugh, smile, giggle? <break time='400ms'/> Giggle, smile, laugh? <break time='400ms'/> or Smile, giggle, laugh? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! A smile is quiet, a giggle is in the middle, and a laugh is the biggest!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Sort these words into the correct group!</emphasis><break time='400ms'/></speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Animals are living creatures. Colors describe how things look.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Sort these words into the correct group!</emphasis><break time='400ms'/></speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Fruits are usually sweet. Vegetables are usually green or orange.</speak>

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Sort these words into the correct group!</emphasis><break time='400ms'/></speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think about the SIZE of each thing in real life.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> You read a book about the ocean. Now someone asks: "What lives in the ocean?"<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>The BEST answer is...</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Dogs and cats? <break time='400ms'/> Fish, whales, and dolphins? <break time='400ms'/> Cars and trucks? <break time='400ms'/> or Trees and flowers? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think about what you learned from the ocean book!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Your teacher says: "Line up in a row."<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What does "in a row" mean?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> In a circle? <break time='400ms'/> Running around? <break time='400ms'/> Sitting down? <break time='400ms'/> or One behind the other in a line? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! When things are 'in a row,' they make a straight line!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> You read a book about bears that said bears HIBERNATE in winter.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What does hibernate mean?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Swim in the river? <break time='400ms'/> Eat a lot of food? <break time='400ms'/> Run really fast? <break time='400ms'/> or Sleep for a long time? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Bears go to sleep for the whole winter ‚Äî that's hibernating!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Your friend says: "That puzzle is really TRICKY."<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What does TRICKY mean?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Hard to figure out? <break time='400ms'/> Silly? <break time='400ms'/> Easy? <break time='400ms'/> or Boring? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! If something is tricky, you really have to think to solve it!</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>After reading about seasons, which word BEST describes what happens to leaves in fall?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> They stay the same.? <break time='400ms'/> They turn into flowers.? <break time='400ms'/> They change color and fall down.? <break time='400ms'/> or They grow bigger? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think about what you know about fall ‚Äî what happens to the trees?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a cheerful, clear elementary school teacher reading to a small child:

script_text: <speak> Bella picked three red apples from the tree. She put them in her basket.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>How many apples did Bella pick?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Two? <break time='400ms'/> One? <break time='400ms'/> Four? <break time='400ms'/> or Three? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Read the first sentence again ‚Äî how many apples?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The frog sat on a lily pad in the pond. He was waiting for a fly.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Where was the frog sitting?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> On a lily pad? <break time='400ms'/> On a rock? <break time='400ms'/> In the mud? <break time='400ms'/> or On the grass? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Look at the first sentence ‚Äî where did the frog sit?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Emma walked to school with her friend Jake. They talked about their favorite animals.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Who did Emma walk with?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Her dog? <break time='400ms'/> Her mom? <break time='400ms'/> Her sister? <break time='400ms'/> or Her friend Jake? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Read the first sentence ‚Äî who walked with Emma?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Dad made pancakes for breakfast. He put blueberries on top.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What did Dad put on the pancakes?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Chocolate chips? <break time='400ms'/> Syrup? <break time='400ms'/> Bananas? <break time='400ms'/> or Blueberries? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Read the second sentence ‚Äî what went on top?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The kitten climbed the tall tree. It was scared to come down.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>How did the kitten feel?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Happy? <break time='400ms'/> Hungry? <break time='400ms'/> Sleepy? <break time='400ms'/> or Scared? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The second sentence tells you how the kitten felt.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Tom wanted to win the race. He practiced running every day. On race day, he came in first!<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the lesson of this story?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Running is boring? <break time='400ms'/> Races are scary? <break time='400ms'/> Tom is the fastest kid? <break time='400ms'/> or Practice helps you get better? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! What did Tom do before the race that helped him win?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Mia did not share her crayons. Her friends stopped playing with her. Mia felt sad and lonely.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the lesson of this story?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Sharing is important? <break time='400ms'/> Friends are mean? <break time='400ms'/> Crayons are important? <break time='400ms'/> or Drawing is fun? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! What happened when Mia didn't share?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The ant worked hard all summer saving food. The grasshopper played all day. When winter came, the ant had food but the grasshopper did not.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the lesson?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Winter is cold? <break time='400ms'/> Ants are better than grasshoppers? <break time='400ms'/> It is good to plan ahead? <break time='400ms'/> or Playing is bad? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Who was ready for winter and why?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Leo tried to ride his bike but kept falling. His mom said, "Keep trying!" After many tries, Leo could ride all by himself.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What happened first in the story?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Leo rode his bike? <break time='400ms'/> Leo kept falling? <break time='400ms'/> Leo stopped trying? <break time='400ms'/> or Mom said keep trying? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! What happened at the beginning before he learned?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Sara told a lie about breaking the vase. She felt bad all day. She told the truth and felt much better.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the lesson?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Parents get angry? <break time='400ms'/> Vases break easily? <break time='400ms'/> Don't touch vases? <break time='400ms'/> or Lying makes you feel bad? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! How did Sara feel after she told the truth vs. the lie?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The kind old woman lived in a tiny cottage by the sea. She fed the birds every morning.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Where does the story take place?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> In the mountains? <break time='400ms'/> By the sea? <break time='400ms'/> In a city? <break time='400ms'/> or In a forest? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Look for the words that tell you where the woman lives.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Ben was always helping others. He carried bags for his neighbor and shared his lunch with friends.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What word best describes Ben?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Lazy? <break time='400ms'/> Funny? <break time='400ms'/> Kind? <break time='400ms'/> or Shy? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Think about what Ben does ‚Äî helping and sharing.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> It was a dark and stormy night. The wind howled outside the old barn.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What is the setting?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> A sunny beach? <break time='400ms'/> A dark, stormy barn? <break time='400ms'/> A quiet park? <break time='400ms'/> or A busy school? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The setting is WHERE and WHEN the story happens.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Rosa found a lost puppy. She gave it water and food. Then she found its owner.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>What was the major event?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Rosa found a lost puppy? <break time='400ms'/> Rosa ate lunch? <break time='400ms'/> Rosa played outside? <break time='400ms'/> or Rosa went to school? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! What is the most important thing that happened?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Grumpy Gus never smiled. He frowned at everyone. One day a little girl gave him a flower and he finally smiled.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>How does Gus change in the story?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> He goes from grumpy to happy? <break time='400ms'/> He falls asleep? <break time='400ms'/> He gets angrier? <break time='400ms'/> or He runs away? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! How is Gus different at the end compared to the beginning?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The bright sun warmed her face.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which word helps you feel the sun?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Face? <break time='400ms'/> Bright? <break time='400ms'/> Sun? <break time='400ms'/> or Her? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Which word helps you imagine what the sun looks and feels like?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The puppy whimpered softly in the rain.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>How does the puppy probably feel?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Excited? <break time='400ms'/> Angry? <break time='400ms'/> Happy? <break time='400ms'/> or Sad or scared? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! What does 'whimpered' sound like? Happy or sad?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The cookies smelled sweet and warm from the oven.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which words appeal to your sense of smell?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> The and from? <break time='400ms'/> Cookies and oven? <break time='400ms'/> Sweet and warm? <break time='400ms'/> or Smelled and the? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Which words describe how the cookies smell?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Jake stomped his feet and crossed his arms.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>How does Jake feel?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Silly? <break time='400ms'/> Happy? <break time='400ms'/> Angry? <break time='400ms'/> or Tired? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! When people stomp and cross their arms, how do they usually feel?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> The soft, fluffy blanket kept her cozy all night.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which words help you imagine how the blanket feels?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Kept and night? <break time='400ms'/> Blanket and cozy? <break time='400ms'/> Soft and fluffy? <break time='400ms'/> or Her and all? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Which words describe what the blanket feels like when you touch it?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>A book about a talking rabbit who goes on an adventure is what type of book?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Informational? <break time='400ms'/> Cookbook? <break time='400ms'/> Storybook? <break time='400ms'/> or Dictionary? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Can rabbits really talk? If it's made up, it's a story.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>A book with facts about how plants grow is what type of book?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Informational book? <break time='400ms'/> Storybook? <break time='400ms'/> Fairy tale? <break time='400ms'/> or Poem? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Does this book teach real facts or tell a made-up story?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which is TRUE about storybooks?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> They don't have pictures? <break time='400ms'/> They have made-up characters and events? <break time='400ms'/> They are always short? <break time='400ms'/> or They have only facts? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Stories come from someone's imagination.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>Which is TRUE about informational books?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> They have made-up characters? <break time='400ms'/> They have talking animals? <break time='400ms'/> They are always funny? <break time='400ms'/> or They teach real facts? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Informational means it gives you real information.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Once upon a time, a brave knight saved a dragon.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Is this from a story or an informational book?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Textbook? <break time='400ms'/> Informational book? <break time='400ms'/> News article? <break time='400ms'/> or Story? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! 'Once upon a time' is a clue! Real fact books don't start this way.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> I went to the store with my mom. I picked out a red apple.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Who is telling this story?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Mom? <break time='400ms'/> The store owner? <break time='400ms'/> A teacher? <break time='400ms'/> or The child (I)? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Look at the word 'I' ‚Äî who is the 'I' in the story?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> Sam ran to the park. He played on the swings.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Who is telling this story?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Sam is telling it? <break time='400ms'/> Sam's mom? <break time='400ms'/> A narrator outside the story? <break time='400ms'/> or Sam's friend? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! The story says 'He' not 'I' ‚Äî someone else is telling us about Sam.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> "I love pizza!" said Maria.<break time='400ms'/> <emphasis level='moderate'>Who is speaking?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> Maria? <break time='400ms'/> The narrator? <break time='400ms'/> Maria's mom? <break time='400ms'/> or The pizza maker? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! Look at the words inside the quotation marks and who 'said' them.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> <emphasis level='moderate'>If a story uses the words I and my, who is telling it?</emphasis><break time='400ms'/> The author only? <break time='400ms'/> A character in the story? <break time='400ms'/> No one? <break time='400ms'/> or Someone outside the story? <break time='400ms'/> What do you think?</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak>Here's a hint! When you see 'I' and 'my,' a character is talking about themselves.</speak>
voice_direction: Read this like a friendly, clear teacher reading to a student:

script_text: <speak> "Let's go!" shouted Tom.
